data:
1
00:00:01,000 --> 00:00:11,000
Ripped, corrected and synched
by Fingersmaster. Enjoy!

2
00:04:20,300 --> 00:04:23,078
You are confused, aren't you?
Frightened.

3
00:04:23,178 --> 00:04:24,830
That's all right. I can help you.

4
00:04:24,930 --> 00:04:26,430
- Who is this?
- I am a doctor.

5
00:04:26,531 --> 00:04:27,916
Now, you must listen to me.

6
00:04:28,017 --> 00:04:30,628
You have lost your memory.
There was an experiment.

7
00:04:30,728 --> 00:04:32,546
Something went wrong.
Your memory was erased.

8
00:04:32,646 --> 00:04:33,689
Do you understand me?

9
00:04:33,789 --> 00:04:35,816
No, I don't understand.
What the hell is going on here?

10
00:04:35,916 --> 00:04:38,402
Just listen. There are people
coming for you even as we speak.

11
00:04:38,502 --> 00:04:41,320
You must not let them find you.
You must leave now.

12
00:04:42,114 --> 00:04:44,866
Hello? Are you there?

13
00:05:43,967 --> 00:05:46,370
Hey, Mr. Murdoch.
The Automat called.

14
00:05:46,470 --> 00:05:49,289
Said you left your wallet there.

15
00:05:49,389 --> 00:05:52,584
I suggest you retrieve it since
you only paid for 3 weeks...

16
00:05:52,684 --> 00:05:54,560
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

17
00:05:56,647 --> 00:05:58,173
I've been here 3 weeks?

18
00:05:58,273 --> 00:06:00,608
It's right there in
black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

19
00:06:01,318 --> 00:06:03,069
Day and date.

20
00:06:03,737 --> 00:06:07,141
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

21
00:06:07,241 --> 00:06:09,018
I'll take care of it when I get back.

22
00:06:09,118 --> 00:06:11,228
See that you do.
Only thing makes you a guest...

23
00:06:11,328 --> 00:06:13,621
in this joint, pal,
is cash on the barrelhead.

24
00:06:37,646 --> 00:06:40,132
House rules.
3 weeks is 3 weeks.

25
00:06:40,232 --> 00:06:42,984
No days off for good behavior.

26
00:07:04,965 --> 00:07:08,535
Mr. Murdoch, yes, where is he?

27
00:07:08,635 --> 00:07:12,346
He... he just left not 5 minutes ago.

28
00:07:15,392 --> 00:07:17,518
Sleep now.

29
00:07:57,684 --> 00:07:58,684
Hey, sweetie!

30
00:07:59,686 --> 00:08:01,713
He said he was your
husband's doctor.

31
00:08:01,813 --> 00:08:03,272
He wanted to speak with you.

32
00:08:23,669 --> 00:08:24,669
Excuse me.

33
00:08:26,505 --> 00:08:27,614
Dr. Sh...

34
00:08:27,714 --> 00:08:30,701
Schreber.
Please, won't you come in?

35
00:08:30,801 --> 00:08:32,885
You must be Emma Murdoch.

36
00:08:33,804 --> 00:08:36,889
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

37
00:08:38,725 --> 00:08:40,434
What is this?

38
00:08:41,395 --> 00:08:45,382
A rather crude experiment...
designed to further my studies.

39
00:08:45,482 --> 00:08:46,592
I don't understand.

40
00:08:46,692 --> 00:08:51,722
You say you're my husband's doctor,
but he never mentioned you to me.

41
00:08:51,822 --> 00:08:53,098
The truth is, Mrs. Murdoch...

42
00:08:53,198 --> 00:08:55,601
John has been coming to
see me for quite some time.

43
00:08:55,701 --> 00:08:59,354
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

44
00:08:59,454 --> 00:09:02,524
stemming from your
marital difficulties.

45
00:09:02,624 --> 00:09:04,792
- John told you what happened?
- Yes.

46
00:09:05,877 --> 00:09:08,113
When was the last time
that you saw him?

47
00:09:08,213 --> 00:09:09,615
3 weeks ago.

48
00:09:09,715 --> 00:09:13,410
He packed a suitcase.
He was very angry at me.

49
00:09:13,510 --> 00:09:16,455
I understand how difficult
this must be for you.

50
00:09:16,555 --> 00:09:18,123
But for John's sake,
I would like you...

51
00:09:18,223 --> 00:09:20,792
to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

52
00:09:20,892 --> 00:09:24,588
It appears that John has suffered
a psychotic break.

53
00:09:24,688 --> 00:09:25,938
Complete memory loss.

54
00:09:27,566 --> 00:09:29,509
He may be delusional.

55
00:09:29,609 --> 00:09:31,470
Even violent.

56
00:09:31,570 --> 00:09:32,987
Emma...

57
00:09:34,281 --> 00:09:37,392
if he were to contact you,
and I suspect he will...

58
00:09:37,492 --> 00:09:40,312
you must call me immediately.
Do you understand?

59
00:09:40,412 --> 00:09:44,691
It is imperative that I be
the first one to reach him.

60
00:09:44,791 --> 00:09:48,127
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

61
00:09:50,047 --> 00:09:52,006
...for himself.

62
00:10:02,142 --> 00:10:03,961
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.

63
00:10:04,061 --> 00:10:06,755
It is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

64
00:10:06,855 --> 00:10:10,733
Mr... was it
"J"... something... Murdoch?

65
00:10:13,653 --> 00:10:14,805
J. Murdoch.

66
00:10:14,905 --> 00:10:18,407
What's your name? Justin? Jerry?

67
00:10:19,242 --> 00:10:20,493
No.

68
00:10:22,120 --> 00:10:24,147
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

69
00:10:24,247 --> 00:10:25,607
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?

70
00:10:25,707 --> 00:10:26,817
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

71
00:10:26,917 --> 00:10:29,377
Ha ha ha ha!

72
00:10:30,170 --> 00:10:31,170
Hi.

73
00:11:11,044 --> 00:11:12,378
Bumstead.

74
00:11:14,131 --> 00:11:17,242
I told the guy,
"Cash on the barrelhead."

75
00:11:17,342 --> 00:11:20,746
I said, "Listen, 3 weeks is 3 weeks."

76
00:11:20,846 --> 00:11:21,997
Where's our lucky winner?

77
00:11:22,097 --> 00:11:24,875
Upstairs, sir, room, uh, 614.

78
00:11:24,975 --> 00:11:27,669
Another call girl.

79
00:11:27,769 --> 00:11:30,312
"J. Murdoch."

80
00:11:31,481 --> 00:11:33,133
Evening, Husselbeck.

81
00:11:33,233 --> 00:11:34,509
Inspector Bumstead.

82
00:11:34,609 --> 00:11:37,095
Your lace is untied.

83
00:11:37,195 --> 00:11:38,863
Sir.

84
00:11:49,749 --> 00:11:51,193
Am I glad you're here, sir.

85
00:11:51,293 --> 00:11:53,862
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

86
00:11:53,962 --> 00:11:56,255
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

87
00:12:03,513 --> 00:12:07,433
Wow. Looks like somebody
woke up on the wrong side of the bed.

88
00:12:50,477 --> 00:12:52,563
- Hello.
- Oh, it's you.

89
00:12:52,863 --> 00:12:54,371
You left your wallet here, buddy.

90
00:12:54,471 --> 00:12:55,775
When... when, when did I do that?

91
00:12:55,875 --> 00:12:56,883
When you was last here.

92
00:12:56,983 --> 00:13:00,053
- When... when was that?
- When you left your wallet.

93
00:13:00,153 --> 00:13:01,946
You expect me to remember?

94
00:13:04,741 --> 00:13:07,993
Hello. Excuse me.

95
00:13:08,912 --> 00:13:10,814
No, no, seriously.

96
00:13:13,667 --> 00:13:15,084
Alleged?

97
00:13:29,349 --> 00:13:31,418
- Where you headed, chief?
- Home.

98
00:13:31,518 --> 00:13:32,602
And where's home?

99
00:13:32,702 --> 00:13:35,007
Haven't you mugs got anything better to do?

100
00:13:35,397 --> 00:13:37,591
Well, I'm just trying
to do my job, May.

101
00:13:37,691 --> 00:13:39,718
There's a killer out there
in case you hadn't noticed.

102
00:13:39,818 --> 00:13:42,528
Maybe you should be out looking for him
instead of cooling your heels, huh?

103
00:13:45,865 --> 00:13:47,533
Aw, go on, get out of here.

104
00:13:55,875 --> 00:13:56,875
Come on.

105
00:13:58,044 --> 00:14:00,296
Round and round she goes.

106
00:14:02,716 --> 00:14:06,844
Where she stops? Nobody knows.

107
00:14:10,015 --> 00:14:13,084
What's that make so far, Husselbeck?
6 hookers in all?

108
00:14:13,184 --> 00:14:14,586
I believe so, sir.

109
00:14:14,686 --> 00:14:17,130
Give the man an "A" for effort.

110
00:14:17,230 --> 00:14:19,424
You'd think these stiffs
would have the good grace...

111
00:14:19,524 --> 00:14:21,650
to expire at a good time of night.

112
00:14:22,652 --> 00:14:24,612
Hey, too bad about Walenski, huh?

113
00:14:28,283 --> 00:14:29,825
I guess he'd seen enough.

114
00:14:36,916 --> 00:14:38,116
So, Husselbeck...

115
00:14:39,177 --> 00:14:41,677
what kind of killer do you think...

116
00:14:42,578 --> 00:14:45,659
stops to save a dying fish?

117
00:14:45,759 --> 00:14:46,759
You've got me, sir.

118
00:14:46,861 --> 00:14:48,870
Bumstead, what took you?

119
00:14:48,970 --> 00:14:52,165
This killer's been running circles around us,
thanks to Walenski.

120
00:14:52,265 --> 00:14:54,000
With all due respect, Chief Inspector...

121
00:14:54,100 --> 00:14:55,700
I've known Eddie a long time.

122
00:14:55,800 --> 00:14:57,000
He's a good cop.

123
00:14:57,103 --> 00:15:01,258
Whatever kind of cop Walenski once was,
he let drift a long time ago.

124
00:15:01,358 --> 00:15:02,864
Let me talk to Bumstead!

125
00:15:03,234 --> 00:15:04,511
Come on, let's go.

126
00:15:04,611 --> 00:15:05,729
Hold on!

127
00:15:06,029 --> 00:15:07,565
Frank, Frank!

128
00:15:09,780 --> 00:15:10,780
Get his arm!

129
00:15:10,880 --> 00:15:11,880
They're watching us!

130
00:15:11,980 --> 00:15:12,980
On your feet.

131
00:15:13,080 --> 00:15:14,435
There's no way out!

132
00:15:14,537 --> 00:15:15,814
Don't make us hurt you.

133
00:15:15,914 --> 00:15:17,723
God, can't you see?!

134
00:15:21,002 --> 00:15:22,279
Let me go, let me go!

135
00:15:22,379 --> 00:15:23,837
I'm not gonna hurt you. I'm not...

136
00:15:24,923 --> 00:15:27,132
- What was that?
- Walenski.

137
00:15:35,517 --> 00:15:38,628
I'm being punished for my sins, right?

138
00:15:38,728 --> 00:15:41,047
What did I ever do to inherit this?

139
00:15:41,147 --> 00:15:42,173
Where do you begin?

140
00:15:42,273 --> 00:15:47,220
Well, everything Detective Walenski
committed to paper should be here, so...

141
00:15:47,320 --> 00:15:50,823
The only thing that should
be committed is Walenski.

142
00:15:52,409 --> 00:15:54,743
Nothing like a little healthy paranoia.

143
00:15:58,289 --> 00:16:01,417
Sir, we just got
the fingerprint results in.

144
00:16:04,796 --> 00:16:06,547
What is this, some kind of joke?

145
00:16:10,802 --> 00:16:12,177
Don't throw anything away.

146
00:16:18,309 --> 00:16:19,393
Inspector Bumstead.

147
00:16:21,688 --> 00:16:24,398
I came here to file
a missing persons report for my husband.

148
00:16:25,191 --> 00:16:27,010
Take it to the front desk.

149
00:16:27,110 --> 00:16:28,944
They told me to come see you.

150
00:16:30,697 --> 00:16:32,906
His name's John Murdoch.

151
00:16:33,950 --> 00:16:36,936
Mrs. Murdoch,
why didn't you report this before?

152
00:16:37,036 --> 00:16:42,150
I mean, if your husband has been missing
as long as you say...

153
00:16:42,250 --> 00:16:44,960
I thought he'd simply
walked out on me.

154
00:16:46,129 --> 00:16:50,033
Then a... doctor contacted me
this evening.

155
00:16:50,133 --> 00:16:51,701
How long have you been married?

156
00:16:51,801 --> 00:16:53,036
Nearly four years.

157
00:16:53,936 --> 00:16:55,737
Why do you ask?

158
00:16:56,097 --> 00:16:59,125
Because you seem uncomfortable
with your ring.

159
00:16:59,225 --> 00:17:02,837
As if you were...
unaccustomed to wearing it.

160
00:17:02,937 --> 00:17:04,396
No, I never take it off.

161
00:17:10,945 --> 00:17:14,990
Do these names
mean anything to you?

162
00:17:20,330 --> 00:17:22,247
No. Who are these women?

163
00:17:23,124 --> 00:17:24,833
Why are you looking
for my husband?

164
00:17:25,543 --> 00:17:27,320
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

165
00:17:27,420 --> 00:17:29,656
Maybe. Maybe murder.

166
00:17:29,756 --> 00:17:30,898
Whose murder?

167
00:17:32,217 --> 00:17:33,442
Which one?

168
00:17:34,343 --> 00:17:36,028
All of them.

169
00:17:36,888 --> 00:17:39,098
Mrs. Murdoch, I am sorry, I'm sorry.

170
00:17:39,198 --> 00:17:40,525
I didn't mean to alarm you.

171
00:17:40,625 --> 00:17:42,711
I'm so sorry that I came.
Just both made a mistake.

172
00:17:42,811 --> 00:17:44,212
Mrs. Murdoch, if you please.

173
00:17:44,312 --> 00:17:46,772
If you'll just give me
half a second to explain...

174
00:17:49,067 --> 00:17:51,109
I'll be right out.

175
00:18:15,260 --> 00:18:17,495
Have we met before?

176
00:18:17,595 --> 00:18:21,166
If we did...
I hope you're still breathing.

177
00:18:21,266 --> 00:18:22,891
What's your name, honey?

178
00:18:24,561 --> 00:18:25,579
John.

179
00:18:26,379 --> 00:18:28,438
Well, that's an appropriate name.

180
00:18:30,115 --> 00:18:31,115
Yeah.

181
00:18:36,489 --> 00:18:37,656
I was just thinking.

182
00:18:41,870 --> 00:18:43,453
What you do...

183
00:18:44,664 --> 00:18:47,901
seems kind of dangerous...

184
00:18:48,001 --> 00:18:49,944
right now.

185
00:18:50,044 --> 00:18:51,738
I mean, how do you know
I'm not the killer?

186
00:18:51,838 --> 00:18:55,007
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

187
00:18:56,217 --> 00:18:58,703
You feeling any urges
I should know about?

188
00:19:20,283 --> 00:19:21,867
Aw, shoot.

189
00:20:20,551 --> 00:20:24,262
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

190
00:20:27,233 --> 00:20:28,418
Who are you?

191
00:20:28,518 --> 00:20:32,030
We might ask the same question, yes?

192
00:20:32,230 --> 00:20:34,815
Sleep now.

193
00:21:01,592 --> 00:21:02,592
He can tune.

194
00:21:55,605 --> 00:21:58,841
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

195
00:21:58,941 --> 00:22:00,802
It is said he is able to tune.

196
00:22:00,902 --> 00:22:02,220
Impossible.

197
00:22:02,320 --> 00:22:05,056
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

198
00:22:05,156 --> 00:22:07,517
On occasion the imprinting
does not take.

199
00:22:07,617 --> 00:22:10,520
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

200
00:22:10,620 --> 00:22:14,190
We find them wandering
like lost children.

201
00:22:14,290 --> 00:22:16,401
But this one was different, yes?

202
00:22:16,501 --> 00:22:18,111
What has the doctor
to say about this?

203
00:22:18,211 --> 00:22:20,154
He has failed to report in.

204
00:22:20,254 --> 00:22:23,324
- And Mr. Quick?
- No more Mr. Quick.

205
00:22:23,424 --> 00:22:26,426
Mr. Quick, dead, yes.

206
00:22:29,472 --> 00:22:32,000
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

207
00:22:32,100 --> 00:22:34,976
Mr. Book, does he know?

208
00:22:36,312 --> 00:22:38,146
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

209
00:22:39,107 --> 00:22:41,926
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

210
00:22:42,026 --> 00:22:44,945
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

211
00:22:46,030 --> 00:22:48,516
Mr. Night, you will take the East.

212
00:22:48,616 --> 00:22:51,352
Mr. Face, you the West.

213
00:22:51,452 --> 00:22:53,479
Mr. Glove, the South.

214
00:22:53,579 --> 00:22:55,831
Mr. Shade, the North.

215
00:22:57,375 --> 00:23:00,335
We must have this man.

216
00:23:13,975 --> 00:23:18,979
Do you really think my husband could be
capable of committing those murders?

217
00:23:19,564 --> 00:23:21,606
Do you?

218
00:23:22,650 --> 00:23:26,111
Let's hope, for both our sakes,
that I'm wrong.

219
00:23:54,223 --> 00:23:55,473
John.

220
00:24:09,822 --> 00:24:11,990
I've been so worried about you.

221
00:24:15,369 --> 00:24:17,396
Are you punishing me?

222
00:24:17,496 --> 00:24:20,066
You know, if disappearing
is your way of punishing me...

223
00:24:20,166 --> 00:24:21,192
I don't appreciate it.

224
00:24:21,292 --> 00:24:23,335
I don't know what
you're talking about.

225
00:24:26,172 --> 00:24:28,616
I found these keys in my pocket...

226
00:24:28,716 --> 00:24:31,369
so I assume I live here.

227
00:24:31,469 --> 00:24:33,162
You supposed to be my wife?

228
00:24:33,262 --> 00:24:35,248
Supposed to be?

229
00:24:35,348 --> 00:24:37,349
John.

230
00:24:37,850 --> 00:24:39,585
You really...

231
00:24:39,685 --> 00:24:42,839
don't know who I am, do you?

232
00:24:42,939 --> 00:24:44,090
Your doctor called me.

233
00:24:44,190 --> 00:24:45,591
He was worried
that this might happen.

234
00:24:45,691 --> 00:24:46,935
My doctor?

235
00:24:47,235 --> 00:24:49,320
Yeah. He, uh...

236
00:24:49,820 --> 00:24:51,764
he gave me his card.

237
00:24:51,864 --> 00:24:54,350
He's desperate to find you.

238
00:24:54,450 --> 00:24:56,952
Schreber.

239
00:25:01,290 --> 00:25:03,317
I feel like I'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

240
00:25:03,417 --> 00:25:06,211
What happened to me?
Why was I seeing a doctor?

241
00:25:06,921 --> 00:25:09,047
I had an affair.

242
00:25:10,132 --> 00:25:12,550
You were angry at me.

243
00:25:15,012 --> 00:25:16,789
The police are looking for you.

244
00:25:16,889 --> 00:25:19,125
I know. I saw the papers.

245
00:25:19,225 --> 00:25:21,810
"Killer stalks city streetwalkers."

246
00:25:25,314 --> 00:25:28,843
I was with one of those women...

247
00:25:28,943 --> 00:25:30,735
before I came here tonight.

248
00:25:31,404 --> 00:25:33,014
I don't understand.

249
00:25:33,114 --> 00:25:34,572
I... I met her outside an Automat.

250
00:25:36,075 --> 00:25:38,603
I guess I wanted to test myself.

251
00:25:38,703 --> 00:25:42,265
I wanted to know if I had it in me
to do those things.

252
00:25:42,665 --> 00:25:44,294
Maybe I have lost my mind,

253
00:25:44,395 --> 00:25:47,352
but whoever I am, I'm still me
and I'm not a killer.

254
00:25:53,292 --> 00:25:54,893
I believe you.

255
00:25:56,470 --> 00:25:57,738
You do?

256
00:26:01,951 --> 00:26:02,993
What?

257
00:26:03,093 --> 00:26:05,630
The car outside,
the one you arrived in.

258
00:26:05,730 --> 00:26:08,123
It's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

259
00:26:10,192 --> 00:26:12,762
I didn't know he was still here.

260
00:26:12,862 --> 00:26:13,903
John.

261
00:26:15,197 --> 00:26:17,949
Hold it right there, mister!

262
00:26:19,327 --> 00:26:21,229
Wait. You have the wrong man.

263
00:26:21,329 --> 00:26:22,396
Stand aside, will you, please?

264
00:26:22,496 --> 00:26:24,023
I didn't kill anyone.

265
00:26:24,123 --> 00:26:27,250
Right now what you are is a suspect.
Turn yourself in.

266
00:26:28,169 --> 00:26:29,695
I'll listen to whatever you have to say.

267
00:26:29,795 --> 00:26:31,671
You're not gonna believe
what I have to say.

268
00:26:32,798 --> 00:26:33,882
Try me.

269
00:26:34,467 --> 00:26:35,993
There's someone after me.

270
00:26:36,093 --> 00:26:39,163
There's this... this group of men.
They want me dead.

271
00:26:39,263 --> 00:26:41,890
And I don't even know if...
They're not even...

272
00:26:42,641 --> 00:26:44,835
Yeah, who's gonna listen to a madman?

273
00:26:44,935 --> 00:26:46,671
Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.

274
00:26:46,771 --> 00:26:47,896
Run!

275
00:26:51,734 --> 00:26:54,486
No one ever listens to me.

276
00:26:59,992 --> 00:27:01,159
Murdoch, stop!

277
00:27:06,207 --> 00:27:07,582
Murdoch!

278
00:27:43,786 --> 00:27:44,829
How much further?

279
00:27:44,929 --> 00:27:46,371
We're almost there, buddy.

280
00:27:49,041 --> 00:27:52,278
Hey, you happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

281
00:27:52,378 --> 00:27:55,239
You're kidding. Me and the missus
spent our honeymoon there.

282
00:27:55,339 --> 00:27:58,049
All you gotta do is take
Main Street west to...

283
00:28:00,886 --> 00:28:02,538
Or is it the cross...

284
00:28:02,638 --> 00:28:06,208
You know, that's funny.
I... I can't seem to remember...

285
00:28:06,308 --> 00:28:08,601
if it's Main Street west
or the cross-town.

286
00:28:13,274 --> 00:28:16,761
I'm sorry, Inspector,
I cannot be of more assistance...

287
00:28:16,861 --> 00:28:18,637
but I am running late
for an appointment.

288
00:28:18,737 --> 00:28:20,947
Well, I appreciate
your taking the time.

289
00:28:29,248 --> 00:28:31,484
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

290
00:28:31,584 --> 00:28:36,197
I've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

291
00:28:36,297 --> 00:28:38,908
Murdoch doesn't strike me as one.

292
00:28:39,008 --> 00:28:42,620
Perhaps you are not
accustomed to digging deep enough.

293
00:28:42,720 --> 00:28:45,164
Well, I do know when someone
is lying to me, Doctor.

294
00:28:45,264 --> 00:28:47,833
Forgive me, Inspector,
but you are not a clinician.

295
00:28:47,933 --> 00:28:51,629
Judging personalities
happens to be my business.

296
00:28:51,729 --> 00:28:53,672
Well, maybe you could
give me a few pointers.

297
00:28:53,772 --> 00:28:55,549
Certainly.

298
00:28:55,649 --> 00:28:57,635
Let's take you, for instance.

299
00:28:57,735 --> 00:29:01,013
You are a fastidious man, driven.

300
00:29:01,113 --> 00:29:03,198
Consumed by details.

301
00:29:03,949 --> 00:29:05,867
I would say your life is...

302
00:29:07,161 --> 00:29:08,161
rather lonely.

303
00:29:08,954 --> 00:29:11,539
Good evening, Inspector.
I really must be going.

304
00:29:52,915 --> 00:29:57,252
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

305
00:30:04,009 --> 00:30:05,009
Dr. Schreber.

306
00:30:06,804 --> 00:30:11,432
Most unfortunate it is that we were
forced to seek you out here.

307
00:30:12,351 --> 00:30:15,019
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this...

308
00:30:15,729 --> 00:30:17,021
moisture.

309
00:30:17,439 --> 00:30:20,551
- I'm sorry. I...
- Failed to report in, yes.

310
00:30:20,651 --> 00:30:23,220
I was frightened.
I... I have a weak heart, you know.

311
00:30:23,320 --> 00:30:27,099
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

312
00:30:27,199 --> 00:30:29,810
We found this
in his hotel room.

313
00:30:29,910 --> 00:30:33,772
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

314
00:30:33,872 --> 00:30:34,899
I tried to imprint him...

315
00:30:34,999 --> 00:30:37,067
but he woke up, he knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

316
00:30:37,167 --> 00:30:39,195
I tried to stop him but he was too fast.

317
00:30:39,295 --> 00:30:40,404
He has no memories, then?

318
00:30:40,504 --> 00:30:43,782
Only fragments.
The procedure, it was interrupted.

319
00:30:43,882 --> 00:30:47,620
I... I guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

320
00:30:47,720 --> 00:30:49,246
You have had strays
before, right?

321
00:30:49,346 --> 00:30:52,974
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can tune.

322
00:30:53,392 --> 00:30:56,128
But that's impossible.
I thought only you had that ability.

323
00:30:56,228 --> 00:31:00,466
You will process another template
of the subject's memories, yes?

324
00:31:00,566 --> 00:31:02,259
Of course. I'll imprint him again.

325
00:31:02,359 --> 00:31:06,863
No. We require them
for a quite different purpose.

326
00:31:07,698 --> 00:31:10,100
It's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

327
00:31:10,200 --> 00:31:12,619
We'll talk again
after tonight's tuning, but...

328
00:31:13,203 --> 00:31:14,939
no more delays, yes?

329
00:31:15,039 --> 00:31:19,751
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

330
00:31:27,343 --> 00:31:30,219
You appear quite frail, Doctor.

331
00:31:30,971 --> 00:31:34,474
Perhaps some exercise
would do you good.

332
00:31:48,113 --> 00:31:49,280
- Come in.
- Kate.

333
00:31:54,370 --> 00:31:56,037
- How is he?
- The same.

334
00:31:57,414 --> 00:31:59,999
Walenski? It's me, Frank.

335
00:32:06,340 --> 00:32:07,840
Come in, Frank.

336
00:32:10,719 --> 00:32:12,637
Close the door.

337
00:32:20,062 --> 00:32:23,382
I've been looking through
some of your old reports.

338
00:32:23,482 --> 00:32:25,483
It's an interesting case.

339
00:32:26,652 --> 00:32:31,432
The kind that can make
a man's career...

340
00:32:31,532 --> 00:32:32,683
or break it.

341
00:32:32,783 --> 00:32:35,060
Yeah, I was on that case.

342
00:32:35,160 --> 00:32:39,356
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

343
00:32:39,456 --> 00:32:41,233
Nothing happened, Frank.

344
00:32:41,333 --> 00:32:45,404
I've just been spending time
on the subway, riding in circles.

345
00:32:45,504 --> 00:32:47,380
Thinking in circles.

346
00:32:48,298 --> 00:32:49,382
There's no way out.

347
00:32:51,176 --> 00:32:53,052
I've been over every inch
of this city.

348
00:32:57,808 --> 00:33:00,085
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

349
00:33:00,185 --> 00:33:01,894
She's not my wife.

350
00:33:03,397 --> 00:33:06,300
I don't know who she is.
I don't know who any of us are.

351
00:33:06,400 --> 00:33:08,260
What makes you say that?

352
00:33:08,360 --> 00:33:10,445
Do you think about
the past much, Frank?

353
00:33:11,905 --> 00:33:13,364
As much as the next guy.

354
00:33:13,991 --> 00:33:17,061
See, I've been trying
to remember things...

355
00:33:17,161 --> 00:33:19,772
clearly remember things
from my past.

356
00:33:19,872 --> 00:33:25,277
But the more I try to think back,
the more it all starts to unravel.

357
00:33:25,377 --> 00:33:26,612
None of it seems real.

358
00:33:26,712 --> 00:33:30,032
It's like I've just been
dreaming this life...

359
00:33:30,132 --> 00:33:33,619
and when I finally wake up
I'll be somebody else.

360
00:33:33,719 --> 00:33:35,553
Somebody totally different.

361
00:33:40,309 --> 00:33:42,961
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie?

362
00:33:43,061 --> 00:33:46,063
Something to do with the case.

363
00:33:46,648 --> 00:33:50,052
There is no case.
There never was!

364
00:33:50,152 --> 00:33:54,572
It's all just a big joke!
It's a joke!

365
00:34:35,072 --> 00:34:37,766
Tonight's requirements are...

366
00:34:37,866 --> 00:34:42,563
12 family photo albums,
9 personal diaries...

367
00:34:42,663 --> 00:34:47,526
17 love letters,
assorted childhood photographs...

368
00:34:47,626 --> 00:34:51,697
26 wallets,
ID's and social security cards.

369
00:34:51,797 --> 00:34:53,881
These do bring back memories.

370
00:34:56,260 --> 00:34:58,412
This one is still warm.

371
00:34:58,512 --> 00:35:00,247
What is it?

372
00:35:00,347 --> 00:35:03,500
The recollections of a great lover?

373
00:35:03,600 --> 00:35:06,545
A catalog of conquests?

374
00:35:06,645 --> 00:35:08,145
We will soon find out.

375
00:35:09,523 --> 00:35:14,094
You wouldn't appreciate that,
would you, Mr. Whatever your name is?

376
00:35:14,194 --> 00:35:18,573
Not the sort of conquests
you would ever understand.

377
00:35:19,533 --> 00:35:20,575
Let's see.

378
00:35:21,869 --> 00:35:24,579
A touch of unhappy childhood.

379
00:35:30,419 --> 00:35:33,129
A dash of teenage rebellion.

380
00:35:34,882 --> 00:35:37,618
And last, but not least...

381
00:35:37,718 --> 00:35:39,912
a tragic death in the family.

382
00:35:40,012 --> 00:35:41,012
Doctor.

383
00:35:43,181 --> 00:35:44,265
Mr. Book.

384
00:35:46,226 --> 00:35:47,544
Whoa!

385
00:35:51,732 --> 00:35:53,425
Why does Murdoch not sleep...

386
00:35:53,525 --> 00:35:55,344
during the tuning as the others do?

387
00:35:55,444 --> 00:35:59,515
I don't know. Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

388
00:35:59,615 --> 00:36:02,434
A... A freak of nature.
He's adapting to survive.

389
00:36:02,534 --> 00:36:05,854
What do you expect?
Weren't you looking for the human soul?

390
00:36:05,954 --> 00:36:08,440
That's the purpose
of your little zoo, isn't it?

391
00:36:08,540 --> 00:36:11,819
That's why you keep changing people
and things around every night.

392
00:36:11,919 --> 00:36:14,947
Maybe you have finally found
what you are looking for...

393
00:36:15,047 --> 00:36:16,498
and it's going to bite you on your...

394
00:36:20,218 --> 00:36:23,789
It requires several of your lifetimes
to master our gifts.

395
00:36:23,889 --> 00:36:27,709
The idea that a simple man
could develop the ability to tune...

396
00:36:27,809 --> 00:36:29,294
Is absurd, I know...

397
00:36:29,394 --> 00:36:31,395
but what other explanation is there?

398
00:36:36,234 --> 00:36:38,235
It is time.

399
00:37:23,407 --> 00:37:24,782
Shut it down.

400
00:37:40,424 --> 00:37:41,799
Get your paper right here!

401
00:37:53,311 --> 00:37:54,963
It's driving me crazy.

402
00:37:55,063 --> 00:37:56,423
I can't sleep.

403
00:37:56,523 --> 00:37:58,258
And they call my job "unskilled".

404
00:37:58,358 --> 00:37:59,593
You think you've got it tough?

405
00:37:59,693 --> 00:38:01,769
You try looking after these kids,
for a change.

406
00:38:02,487 --> 00:38:06,615
Anyways, Frederickson says
he'll take me off the damn night shift soon.

407
00:38:07,159 --> 00:38:09,035
Well, it's about time, dear.

408
00:39:24,820 --> 00:39:25,820
Hello?

409
00:39:28,657 --> 00:39:29,740
Hello?!

410
00:39:34,037 --> 00:39:35,397
Wake up!

411
00:39:35,497 --> 00:39:36,497
Hey!

412
00:39:38,875 --> 00:39:40,152
Wake up!

413
00:39:40,252 --> 00:39:42,169
Wake up!

414
00:39:43,839 --> 00:39:45,756
Wake up!

415
00:39:47,134 --> 00:39:48,884
Hello?!

416
00:39:50,262 --> 00:39:54,306
Can anybody hear me?!

417
00:39:55,392 --> 00:39:58,853
Let the tuning commence.

418
00:42:38,430 --> 00:42:41,416
The Goodwins.
Jeremy, Sylvia...

419
00:42:41,516 --> 00:42:43,809
Jane and little Matthew.

420
00:42:47,605 --> 00:42:49,690
Jane and little Matthew.

421
00:43:19,804 --> 00:43:22,415
The rich get richer.

422
00:43:22,515 --> 00:43:26,143
Probably have maid's quarters
before the night is through.

423
00:44:19,364 --> 00:44:21,268
Dr. Schreber, I presume.

424
00:44:21,699 --> 00:44:22,702
It's you.

425
00:44:22,802 --> 00:44:24,102
Hey, come on.

426
00:44:24,202 --> 00:44:26,313
That's no way to greet a patient, Doctor.

427
00:44:26,413 --> 00:44:28,106
If that's what you are, Doctor?

428
00:44:28,206 --> 00:44:29,566
Mr. Murdoch, please, I...

429
00:44:29,666 --> 00:44:31,743
What is happening here?
Why is everyone asleep?

430
00:44:31,843 --> 00:44:33,862
Please keep your voice down.

431
00:44:33,962 --> 00:44:35,922
Why can't I remember anything?
What have you done to me?

432
00:44:36,022 --> 00:44:38,616
Nothing, nothing.
Please, I want to help you.

433
00:44:38,716 --> 00:44:39,951
We can't talk here.

434
00:44:40,051 --> 00:44:42,203
It is not safe.
If they see us together, they'll...

435
00:44:42,303 --> 00:44:43,663
I don't care.
I want some answers.

436
00:44:43,763 --> 00:44:45,040
I want some answers now!

437
00:44:45,140 --> 00:44:46,249
Who are they?

438
00:44:46,349 --> 00:44:48,209
Why are they trying to kill me?

439
00:44:48,309 --> 00:44:49,476
- Answer me!
- Oh!

440
00:44:54,732 --> 00:44:57,802
My God. You really can do it.

441
00:44:57,902 --> 00:44:59,137
I did that?

442
00:44:59,237 --> 00:45:01,431
Listen to me, John.
You have their power.

443
00:45:01,531 --> 00:45:03,558
You can make things happen
by will alone.

444
00:45:03,658 --> 00:45:06,895
They call it tuning. That is how they make
the buildings change.

445
00:45:06,995 --> 00:45:09,481
Just now you acted out
of self-defense. A reflex.

446
00:45:09,581 --> 00:45:12,359
But I can teach you to control
your power consciously.

447
00:45:12,459 --> 00:45:14,736
Let me help you, John.
Together we can stop them.

448
00:45:14,836 --> 00:45:16,420
We can take the city back.

449
00:45:19,674 --> 00:45:20,674
My glasses.

450
00:45:22,927 --> 00:45:24,887
My glasses, please.

451
00:46:11,976 --> 00:46:14,587
He made a terrible
impression for the firm...

452
00:46:14,687 --> 00:46:16,965
lollygagging around as he did.

453
00:46:17,065 --> 00:46:19,884
So I simply told Frederickson
I was going to have to let him go.

454
00:46:19,984 --> 00:46:22,694
And well you should have, darling.

455
00:46:23,029 --> 00:46:24,404
He attacked me.

456
00:46:25,365 --> 00:46:26,615
I don't know where he has gone.

457
00:46:27,700 --> 00:46:29,576
Come, Dr. Schreber.

458
00:46:30,620 --> 00:46:32,147
We have much to do.

459
00:46:32,247 --> 00:46:33,997
Yes?

460
00:46:34,541 --> 00:46:35,707
Yes.

461
00:48:26,944 --> 00:48:30,390
Tonight's experiment shall be conducted
in the following locations.

462
00:48:30,490 --> 00:48:34,852
The first subject
shall be imprinted here on Avenue M.

463
00:48:34,952 --> 00:48:37,397
Mr. Book. There is a... a problem.

464
00:48:37,497 --> 00:48:40,775
There is no Avenue M.
We were unable to complete it.

465
00:48:40,875 --> 00:48:44,529
During the last tuning
we detected a lack of control.

466
00:48:44,629 --> 00:48:47,240
An opposing influence
on the machines?

467
00:48:47,340 --> 00:48:52,036
Then this man Murdoch
is more powerful than we thought.

468
00:48:52,136 --> 00:48:53,830
He's becoming like us.

469
00:48:53,930 --> 00:48:58,418
So we must become like him.

470
00:48:58,518 --> 00:49:00,878
The good doctor has done as we asked?

471
00:49:00,978 --> 00:49:04,472
The life and times of John Murdoch,
Volume 2.

472
00:49:06,651 --> 00:49:08,886
We must not do this.

473
00:49:08,986 --> 00:49:12,473
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

474
00:49:12,573 --> 00:49:15,184
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

475
00:49:15,284 --> 00:49:17,562
Everywhere he goes...

476
00:49:17,662 --> 00:49:20,231
everyone he seeks out
will be known to us.

477
00:49:20,331 --> 00:49:25,236
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

478
00:49:25,336 --> 00:49:27,947
Perhaps we have forgotten
what happened last time, when we t...

479
00:49:28,047 --> 00:49:31,117
Yes. Poor, poor Mr...

480
00:49:31,217 --> 00:49:33,036
We have not forgotten.

481
00:49:33,136 --> 00:49:40,392
If Mr. Hand wishes to make this sacrifice
for the greater good...

482
00:49:41,018 --> 00:49:42,420
so be it.

483
00:49:42,520 --> 00:49:47,634
But to imprint one of us.
Failure has always resulted.

484
00:49:47,734 --> 00:49:51,220
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

485
00:49:51,320 --> 00:49:52,738
Imprint.

486
00:49:58,411 --> 00:50:00,203
This may sting a bit.

487
00:50:37,033 --> 00:50:38,909
Is it done?

488
00:50:39,660 --> 00:50:42,204
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

489
00:50:43,122 --> 00:50:46,666
I have John Murdoch... in mind.

490
00:50:51,422 --> 00:50:52,631
"Johnny...

491
00:50:53,382 --> 00:50:56,786
"I found this postcard
among your mother's things.

492
00:50:56,886 --> 00:50:58,955
"Brings back memories, doesn't it?

493
00:50:59,055 --> 00:51:00,832
"Stop by sometime.

494
00:51:00,932 --> 00:51:02,667
"We'll see if we can't hook ourselves...

495
00:51:02,767 --> 00:51:04,043
"another mermaid.

496
00:51:04,143 --> 00:51:06,102
"Love to Emma. Karl."

497
00:51:11,984 --> 00:51:13,568
Karl.

498
00:51:14,821 --> 00:51:16,571
Karl Harris.

499
00:51:24,872 --> 00:51:26,248
Harris.

500
00:51:26,707 --> 00:51:28,166
Harris.

501
00:51:30,419 --> 00:51:32,295
"Harris Karl."

502
00:51:34,257 --> 00:51:37,034
Excuse me. Can you tell me
the way to Avenue C?

503
00:51:37,134 --> 00:51:38,343
Try the subway.

504
00:51:42,348 --> 00:51:43,875
You got a problem, pal?

505
00:51:43,975 --> 00:51:46,993
You, uh, been working here long?

506
00:51:47,979 --> 00:51:49,074
25 years.

507
00:51:49,175 --> 00:51:51,658
No days off for good behavior.

508
00:52:16,382 --> 00:52:19,551
We're looking for John Murdoch.

509
00:52:53,544 --> 00:52:55,571
She knows nothing, Mr. Hand.

510
00:52:55,671 --> 00:52:57,740
A dead end, yes, Mr. Wall.

511
00:52:57,840 --> 00:53:00,368
We thought his imprint
would allow us to track him, yes...

512
00:53:00,468 --> 00:53:02,829
but instead we have been brought here.

513
00:53:02,929 --> 00:53:04,497
This is irrational.

514
00:53:04,597 --> 00:53:06,874
Instincts are irrational, Mr. Wall...

515
00:53:06,974 --> 00:53:10,336
and we must follow
where they lead, yes.

516
00:53:10,436 --> 00:53:14,882
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar... his job.

517
00:53:14,982 --> 00:53:16,968
He does not care about our job.

518
00:53:17,068 --> 00:53:19,846
Indulge us, Mr. Hand.

519
00:53:19,946 --> 00:53:21,454
If you were Murdoch...

520
00:53:21,554 --> 00:53:22,557
Yes.

521
00:53:22,657 --> 00:53:24,117
If...

522
00:53:24,607 --> 00:53:26,201
I were Murdoch...

523
00:53:27,828 --> 00:53:29,647
I would remember...

524
00:53:29,747 --> 00:53:33,333
how my wife had hurt me
by sleeping with another man.

525
00:53:34,919 --> 00:53:36,378
And then...

526
00:53:38,089 --> 00:53:41,591
I would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

527
00:53:45,262 --> 00:53:47,582
Leave me alone with her.

528
00:53:47,682 --> 00:53:49,432
There's work to be done.

529
00:53:52,937 --> 00:53:55,172
All change, platform 3.

530
00:53:55,372 --> 00:53:58,050
Platform 3, all change.

531
00:53:58,150 --> 00:53:59,802
All change? Excuse me.

532
00:53:59,902 --> 00:54:01,178
How do I get to the end of the line?

533
00:54:01,278 --> 00:54:02,821
You want the Express.

534
00:54:10,579 --> 00:54:13,474
No trains leave on platform 7.

535
00:54:13,674 --> 00:54:15,192
- You want platform 2.
- Got it. Thanks a lot.

536
00:54:15,292 --> 00:54:16,295
Hey!

537
00:54:16,395 --> 00:54:17,797
How come that train didn't stop?

538
00:54:17,937 --> 00:54:19,337
That's the Express.

539
00:54:20,673 --> 00:54:22,533
There's no way out, you know?

540
00:54:22,633 --> 00:54:25,552
You can't get out of the city.
Believe me, I've tried.

541
00:54:26,637 --> 00:54:28,304
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

542
00:54:28,764 --> 00:54:30,458
The one they've been looking for.

543
00:54:30,558 --> 00:54:32,392
- Who are you?
- Used to be a cop.

544
00:54:33,102 --> 00:54:35,562
At least, in this life, I was.

545
00:54:35,980 --> 00:54:38,064
They steal people's
memories, you know?

546
00:54:38,607 --> 00:54:40,384
Then they swap them around
between us.

547
00:54:40,484 --> 00:54:43,095
I've seen them do it.
Back and forth, back and forth...

548
00:54:43,195 --> 00:54:45,222
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

549
00:54:45,322 --> 00:54:46,557
How do you know all this?

550
00:54:46,657 --> 00:54:50,895
Once in a while, one of us wakes up
while they're changing things.

551
00:54:50,995 --> 00:54:53,189
It's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

552
00:54:53,289 --> 00:54:55,232
It happened to me.

553
00:54:55,332 --> 00:54:57,250
They'll come looking for you, Murdoch.

554
00:54:58,377 --> 00:55:00,003
Just like they'll come looking for me.

555
00:55:00,838 --> 00:55:02,073
But that's OK.

556
00:55:02,173 --> 00:55:03,590
I figured a way out.

557
00:55:15,061 --> 00:55:16,394
They were here.

558
00:55:18,272 --> 00:55:19,507
Last night.

559
00:55:19,607 --> 00:55:21,900
This was to be his home.

560
00:55:24,653 --> 00:55:26,430
That was when we loved her.

561
00:55:26,530 --> 00:55:28,549
This is all well and good, Mr. Hand...

562
00:55:28,649 --> 00:55:33,052
But we require a more practical link
to his present whereabouts.

563
00:55:35,823 --> 00:55:36,873
Yes.

564
00:55:37,825 --> 00:55:40,060
And I know where to find her.

565
00:55:48,302 --> 00:55:51,103
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

566
00:55:51,203 --> 00:55:52,206
I'm sorry?

567
00:55:52,306 --> 00:55:56,559
To be able to revisit those places
which have meant so very much to us.

568
00:55:57,394 --> 00:55:59,622
I thought it was more
that we were haunted by them.

569
00:55:59,722 --> 00:56:01,523
Perhaps.

570
00:56:03,109 --> 00:56:05,017
But imagine a life...

571
00:56:05,177 --> 00:56:07,047
alien to yours...

572
00:56:07,947 --> 00:56:09,598
in which your memories
were not your own...

573
00:56:09,698 --> 00:56:12,743
but those shared
by every other of your kind.

574
00:56:13,994 --> 00:56:16,832
Imagine the torment of such an existence...

575
00:56:18,332 --> 00:56:20,792
no experiences to call your own.

576
00:56:23,420 --> 00:56:25,314
If it was all you knew...

577
00:56:25,714 --> 00:56:27,423
maybe it would be a comfort.

578
00:56:28,092 --> 00:56:30,802
But if you were to discover
something different...

579
00:56:32,054 --> 00:56:33,512
Something...

580
00:56:34,013 --> 00:56:35,230
better.

581
00:56:38,519 --> 00:56:41,088
There used to be a ferry
when I was a boy.

582
00:56:41,188 --> 00:56:42,882
Biggest thing you ever saw.

583
00:56:42,982 --> 00:56:46,109
Lit up like a floating birthday cake.

584
00:56:47,361 --> 00:56:49,555
That's just what my husband
once said to me...

585
00:56:49,655 --> 00:56:51,489
on this very spot.

586
00:56:52,825 --> 00:56:54,643
Where is your husband now?

587
00:56:54,743 --> 00:56:58,246
I wish I knew.
What brings you here?

588
00:56:59,039 --> 00:57:01,859
I met my wife at this place.

589
00:57:01,959 --> 00:57:03,694
It's where I first met my husband.

590
00:57:03,794 --> 00:57:06,045
Small world.

591
00:57:28,234 --> 00:57:30,236
No, no, no.

592
00:57:59,975 --> 00:58:01,392
Hello?

593
00:58:02,102 --> 00:58:03,269
Hello?

594
00:58:48,482 --> 00:58:49,758
What are you doing here?

595
00:58:49,858 --> 00:58:51,734
I've been following you.

596
00:58:55,614 --> 00:58:57,448
Hold it right there!

597
00:58:59,535 --> 00:59:00,910
Johnny?

598
00:59:01,370 --> 00:59:02,863
Johnny!

599
00:59:03,263 --> 00:59:04,856
It's been so damn long...

600
00:59:04,956 --> 00:59:07,292
I thought you'd forgotten your Uncle Karl.

601
00:59:08,085 --> 00:59:09,754
You son of a gun!

602
00:59:12,923 --> 00:59:14,424
Uncle Karl?

603
00:59:17,928 --> 00:59:19,053
Wait.

604
00:59:21,181 --> 00:59:22,666
Is that me?

605
00:59:22,766 --> 00:59:23,933
Yeah.

606
00:59:32,985 --> 00:59:34,970
Shell Beach is where I grew up?

607
00:59:35,070 --> 00:59:36,180
That's what I said.

608
00:59:36,280 --> 00:59:38,557
Shell Beach, your hometown.

609
00:59:38,657 --> 00:59:41,810
I need to get there, Karl.
How do I get there?

610
00:59:41,910 --> 00:59:43,479
I don't know.

611
00:59:43,579 --> 00:59:46,565
- I haven't been there in years.
- Come on. You must remember.

612
00:59:46,665 --> 00:59:48,651
You gotta have some idea.

613
00:59:48,751 --> 00:59:49,860
Come on!

614
00:59:49,960 --> 00:59:51,544
Uh, sorry, Johnny.

615
00:59:53,005 --> 00:59:55,923
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

616
00:59:59,470 --> 01:00:01,038
So bright there.

617
01:00:01,138 --> 01:00:03,431
Brighter times, I guess.

618
01:00:05,142 --> 01:00:07,518
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

619
01:00:08,062 --> 01:00:10,631
That's me and your pa. Ha!

620
01:00:10,731 --> 01:00:12,899
What a couple of handsome fools.

621
01:00:14,068 --> 01:00:15,234
What happened to my parents?

622
01:00:20,157 --> 01:00:21,366
Where are they now?

623
01:00:22,326 --> 01:00:24,270
They're dead, Johnny.

624
01:00:24,370 --> 01:00:26,730
They died when their house
burnt down.

625
01:00:26,830 --> 01:00:28,498
I looked after you.

626
01:00:29,500 --> 01:00:31,517
You don't remember that, really?

627
01:00:34,713 --> 01:00:36,031
What's that?

628
01:00:37,201 --> 01:00:38,508
What is that?

629
01:00:43,222 --> 01:00:44,873
It's a scar.

630
01:00:44,973 --> 01:00:47,778
You burnt your arm pretty bad in the fire.

631
01:00:53,107 --> 01:00:56,401
- What does it mean, Johnny?
- It means these are all lies!

632
01:01:00,322 --> 01:01:02,281
Why are you here, Mrs. Murdoch?

633
01:01:11,417 --> 01:01:13,876
My husband told me
he'd been here.

634
01:01:17,714 --> 01:01:20,007
He told me he wanted
to test himself...

635
01:01:21,218 --> 01:01:23,495
see if he was...

636
01:01:23,595 --> 01:01:25,555
capable of...

637
01:01:34,773 --> 01:01:36,293
I wanted to talk to her.

638
01:01:36,394 --> 01:01:38,668
I thought maybe
she could help me find him.

639
01:01:39,978 --> 01:01:42,238
Stay here.
I'm gonna call the station.

640
01:01:53,584 --> 01:01:55,084
Yeah, this is Bumstead.

641
01:01:55,200 --> 01:01:58,900
Send the homicide squad
to 1440... East, yeah.

642
01:01:59,000 --> 01:02:00,603
There's been another one.

643
01:02:01,842 --> 01:02:03,046
It's the same pattern.

644
01:02:03,147 --> 01:02:04,952
I'll explain when you get here.

645
01:02:14,855 --> 01:02:17,007
Oh, God.

646
01:02:17,107 --> 01:02:19,275
It's OK. I won't hurt you.

647
01:02:19,693 --> 01:02:21,235
It's OK.

648
01:02:31,330 --> 01:02:33,232
Where the hell did she come from?

649
01:02:33,332 --> 01:02:34,832
I found her hiding.

650
01:02:35,584 --> 01:02:37,418
She saw what happened here.

651
01:03:04,488 --> 01:03:07,474
Are you ready to go home, Mrs. Murdoch?

652
01:03:07,574 --> 01:03:10,201
The inspector is gonna take me. Thanks.

653
01:03:35,143 --> 01:03:36,394
It's beautiful.

654
01:03:38,981 --> 01:03:42,217
It was a gift from my mother.

655
01:03:42,317 --> 01:03:44,761
She died recently.

656
01:03:44,861 --> 01:03:47,196
I keep it with me to remind me of her.

657
01:03:49,116 --> 01:03:50,491
I'm sorry.

658
01:03:53,912 --> 01:03:56,023
It's a funny thing, though.

659
01:03:56,123 --> 01:03:58,499
I can't remember
when she gave it to me.

660
01:04:01,044 --> 01:04:04,046
How do you think
I could forget a thing like that?

661
01:04:06,216 --> 01:04:10,386
Do you think about the past much,
Mrs. Murdoch?

662
01:04:12,556 --> 01:04:15,292
What's happening, Inspector?

663
01:04:15,392 --> 01:04:18,060
I'm not sure I know anymore.

664
01:04:21,607 --> 01:04:23,834
I left your old room like it was.

665
01:04:24,234 --> 01:04:26,243
You can sleep here tonight, huh?

666
01:04:26,403 --> 01:04:28,639
Glad to have you back, Johnny...

667
01:04:28,739 --> 01:04:30,549
even if it is for just a night.

668
01:04:30,649 --> 01:04:31,676
Karl.

669
01:04:32,476 --> 01:04:33,769
Is that the right time?

670
01:04:33,869 --> 01:04:34,924
Why, sure.

671
01:04:35,125 --> 01:04:37,689
That clock's kept perfect time
since I bought it.

672
01:04:37,789 --> 01:04:39,582
A.m. or p.m.?

673
01:04:40,751 --> 01:04:42,152
What do you think, Johnny?

674
01:04:42,252 --> 01:04:44,154
I don't understand.
How can it be night already?

675
01:04:44,254 --> 01:04:45,906
What happened to the day?
How'd I miss it?

676
01:04:46,006 --> 01:04:48,825
You're tired. Anything's possible.

677
01:04:48,925 --> 01:04:50,144
Look...

678
01:04:50,344 --> 01:04:53,929
get some sleep. We'll straighten
all this out tomorrow.

679
01:05:19,790 --> 01:05:22,667
"Guide to Shell Beach
by Johnny Murdoch."

680
01:05:25,629 --> 01:05:27,463
Oh, come on.

681
01:05:46,024 --> 01:05:48,385
- Hello?
- Emma, he's here.

682
01:05:48,485 --> 01:05:50,554
He's acting mighty peculiar.

683
01:05:50,654 --> 01:05:52,681
I know. He's not himself.

684
01:05:52,781 --> 01:05:54,641
Keep him there,
and I'll be right over.

685
01:05:54,741 --> 01:05:57,076
- I'll try.
- Thanks, Karl. Bye.

686
01:05:59,621 --> 01:06:00,647
Johnny.

687
01:06:00,747 --> 01:06:02,766
I can't promise anything, Mrs. Murdoch.

688
01:06:02,866 --> 01:06:04,451
We just have to play it as it comes.

689
01:06:04,551 --> 01:06:07,553
Johnny, we...
We just wanted to help.

690
01:06:14,394 --> 01:06:16,055
Karl.

691
01:06:16,555 --> 01:06:18,014
Uncle Karl.

692
01:06:18,114 --> 01:06:20,179
Johnny, if you're in some kind of trouble...

693
01:06:20,279 --> 01:06:22,084
...well, maybe we could do something.

694
01:06:23,186 --> 01:06:25,746
Haven't seen you in so long.

695
01:06:26,022 --> 01:06:27,565
Yes.

696
01:07:40,222 --> 01:07:45,601
Mr. Murdoch... you've been
the cause of much distress.

697
01:07:49,648 --> 01:07:52,008
- Start talking.
- There's no need for this.

698
01:07:52,108 --> 01:07:53,427
There's no escape.

699
01:07:53,527 --> 01:07:55,470
The city's ours. We made it.

700
01:07:55,570 --> 01:07:57,013
What are you talking about?

701
01:07:57,113 --> 01:08:00,225
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories...

702
01:08:00,325 --> 01:08:04,104
different eras, different pasts
all rolled into one.

703
01:08:04,204 --> 01:08:06,648
Each night, we revise it, refine it...

704
01:08:06,748 --> 01:08:08,191
in order to learn.

705
01:08:08,291 --> 01:08:09,609
Learn what?

706
01:08:09,709 --> 01:08:11,111
About you, Mr. Murdoch...

707
01:08:11,211 --> 01:08:13,405
you and your fellow inhabitants...

708
01:08:13,505 --> 01:08:15,297
what makes you human.

709
01:08:15,841 --> 01:08:18,884
- Why?!
- We need to be like you.

710
01:08:19,845 --> 01:08:22,164
I understand you now, Mr. Murdoch.

711
01:08:22,264 --> 01:08:25,751
I remember that which you do not...
what you've been missing.

712
01:08:25,851 --> 01:08:27,518
The ocean, yes...

713
01:08:28,562 --> 01:08:31,131
running along the waves as a child...

714
01:08:31,231 --> 01:08:36,151
meeting Emma at the river...
That first kiss that followed.

715
01:08:36,778 --> 01:08:37,888
What are you?

716
01:08:37,988 --> 01:08:39,681
You've seen what we are.

717
01:08:39,781 --> 01:08:42,700
We use your dead as vessels.

718
01:10:52,414 --> 01:10:53,414
Get in!

719
01:11:08,888 --> 01:11:11,333
What about her? Ring any bells?

720
01:11:11,433 --> 01:11:12,709
She was alive when I left her.

721
01:11:12,809 --> 01:11:13,835
What about this?

722
01:11:13,935 --> 01:11:15,879
This is nothing. I... This is...

723
01:11:15,979 --> 01:11:18,214
It must mean something,
all those pictures.

724
01:11:18,314 --> 01:11:19,481
What pictures?

725
01:11:20,483 --> 01:11:21,668
I don't understand this.

726
01:11:21,768 --> 01:11:24,346
Stop playing games with me, Murdoch!
Stop telling me lies!

727
01:11:24,446 --> 01:11:25,989
I am not telling you lies!

728
01:11:26,089 --> 01:11:28,308
Help me out here.
Make me understand.

729
01:11:28,408 --> 01:11:30,435
I have this jigsaw puzzle
in front of my face...

730
01:11:30,535 --> 01:11:33,580
and every time I try to rearrange the pieces,
it still doesn't make any sense.

731
01:11:33,680 --> 01:11:34,998
What... You... You...
think it makes sense to me?

732
01:11:35,098 --> 01:11:36,983
I'm as much in the dark here as you are.

733
01:11:37,183 --> 01:11:39,251
You let me ask you a question?

734
01:11:40,336 --> 01:11:41,896
You heard of a place called Shell Beach?

735
01:11:41,996 --> 01:11:44,140
- Sure.
- You know how to get there?

736
01:11:44,340 --> 01:11:45,700
- Yeah.
- You tell me?

737
01:11:45,800 --> 01:11:48,343
Oh, all right. You just, uh...

738
01:11:48,544 --> 01:11:50,129
You go to the...

739
01:11:50,847 --> 01:11:51,851
Where? Where do you go?

740
01:11:51,951 --> 01:11:54,016
Just give me a second, will ya?

741
01:11:56,186 --> 01:11:57,853
You can't remember, can you?

742
01:12:00,190 --> 01:12:01,749
You think that's kind of odd?

743
01:12:03,650 --> 01:12:04,650
Wait.

744
01:12:04,750 --> 01:12:06,050
I got a better one for you.

745
01:12:06,150 --> 01:12:07,355
When was the last time...

746
01:12:07,455 --> 01:12:10,255
you remember doing
something during the day?

747
01:12:10,366 --> 01:12:11,493
What do you mean?

748
01:12:11,593 --> 01:12:13,687
I just mean... during the day.

749
01:12:14,587 --> 01:12:15,772
Daylight.

750
01:12:15,872 --> 01:12:17,357
When was the last time
you remember seeing it?

751
01:12:17,457 --> 01:12:21,352
And I'm not talking about some distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

752
01:12:21,452 --> 01:12:24,322
I mean like yesterday?
Last week? When?

753
01:12:24,422 --> 01:12:26,840
Can you come up with a single memory?

754
01:12:28,384 --> 01:12:29,619
You can't, can you?

755
01:12:29,719 --> 01:12:32,372
You know something?
I don't think the sun even...

756
01:12:32,972 --> 01:12:35,625
exists... in this place.

757
01:12:35,725 --> 01:12:38,531
'Cause I've been up for hours
and hours and hours...

758
01:12:38,632 --> 01:12:40,337
and the night never ends here.

759
01:12:40,730 --> 01:12:43,299
- That is crazy.
- You're damn right this is crazy.

760
01:12:43,399 --> 01:12:45,760
Listen to me, Bumstead.
It's not just me.

761
01:12:45,860 --> 01:12:47,804
It's all of us.

762
01:12:47,904 --> 01:12:49,389
They're doing something to all of us.

763
01:12:49,489 --> 01:12:52,183
- Shut up, you... I've... I've heard enough.
- Please listen.

764
01:12:52,283 --> 01:12:54,034
- Shut up, will ya! Shut up!
- Listen to me.

765
01:13:04,254 --> 01:13:07,548
There has to be an explanation
for this somewhere.

766
01:13:15,682 --> 01:13:17,015
Explain this.

767
01:13:37,620 --> 01:13:39,830
John, I'm so sorry.

768
01:13:40,790 --> 01:13:42,567
I never meant to hurt you, John...

769
01:13:42,667 --> 01:13:43,835
and I did it,
and I don't know why I did.

770
01:13:43,935 --> 01:13:45,945
I wish I could take it all back.

771
01:13:46,045 --> 01:13:48,531
No. Emma... You didn't do it.

772
01:13:48,631 --> 01:13:51,326
This... affair of yours,
whatever it is...

773
01:13:51,426 --> 01:13:52,994
the thing you're supposed to have done...

774
01:13:53,094 --> 01:13:54,971
you didn't do it.
I don't believe it ever happened.

775
01:13:55,071 --> 01:13:56,331
What do you mean?

776
01:13:56,431 --> 01:13:58,708
I know this is gonna sound crazy...

777
01:13:58,808 --> 01:14:01,711
but what if we never knew
each other before now?

778
01:14:01,811 --> 01:14:04,130
What if the first time we ever met...

779
01:14:04,230 --> 01:14:08,009
was last night in your...
in our apartment...

780
01:14:08,109 --> 01:14:10,970
and everything you remember...

781
01:14:11,070 --> 01:14:13,890
and everything that I'm supposed
to remember never really happened?

782
01:14:13,990 --> 01:14:16,533
Someone just wants us to think it did.

783
01:14:21,706 --> 01:14:24,082
You know, back in the apartment...

784
01:14:24,876 --> 01:14:27,336
I suddenly felt like
I didn't know you at all.

785
01:14:29,130 --> 01:14:31,632
It was as if you were a stranger.

786
01:14:33,885 --> 01:14:35,636
But how can that be true?

787
01:14:36,221 --> 01:14:40,291
I so vividly remember meeting you.

788
01:14:40,391 --> 01:14:43,435
I remember falling in love with you.

789
01:14:44,270 --> 01:14:46,063
I remember losing you.

790
01:14:46,439 --> 01:14:47,481
Time's up.

791
01:14:48,816 --> 01:14:50,260
No, wait, wait.

792
01:14:50,360 --> 01:14:52,428
Please, just...

793
01:14:52,528 --> 01:14:53,612
just one more minute.

794
01:15:00,119 --> 01:15:02,246
I love you, John.

795
01:15:05,083 --> 01:15:07,793
You can't fake something like that.

796
01:15:08,753 --> 01:15:10,087
No, you can't.

797
01:15:39,617 --> 01:15:42,202
Inspector? Sir?

798
01:15:43,579 --> 01:15:46,107
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

799
01:15:46,207 --> 01:15:49,960
I... kind of thought you should know.

800
01:15:52,588 --> 01:15:55,257
Oh, and...
the chief wanted to see you.

801
01:15:56,426 --> 01:15:57,592
Sir...

802
01:16:03,783 --> 01:16:05,884
I knew you'd track the killer down, sir.

803
01:16:18,180 --> 01:16:19,406
Sir...

804
01:16:21,326 --> 01:16:22,367
shoelace.

805
01:16:35,631 --> 01:16:36,799
How can we help you, sir?

806
01:16:36,899 --> 01:16:38,976
You can sleep.

807
01:16:41,304 --> 01:16:42,347
Gentlemen...

808
01:16:42,447 --> 01:16:43,930
Sleep. Sleep.

809
01:16:47,560 --> 01:16:48,810
Evening, sir.

810
01:16:57,695 --> 01:16:58,779
Bumstead...

811
01:17:01,616 --> 01:17:04,206
I wanted to be the first to congratulate you...

812
01:17:04,407 --> 01:17:05,703
about the case.

813
01:17:07,914 --> 01:17:10,650
Take us to Murdoch.

814
01:17:10,750 --> 01:17:11,833
Sleep.

815
01:17:39,445 --> 01:17:40,763
Dr. Schreber?

816
01:17:42,031 --> 01:17:43,825
I knew you'd come eventually.

817
01:17:43,925 --> 01:17:46,436
Don't you think it's about time
you started giving me some answers?

818
01:17:46,536 --> 01:17:48,688
Yes. Yes, of course.

819
01:17:48,788 --> 01:17:50,539
Won't you please sit down?

820
01:17:53,626 --> 01:17:55,611
I... I come here quite often.

821
01:17:55,711 --> 01:17:58,114
It's one of the few places
I'm allowed a moment's peace.

822
01:17:58,214 --> 01:18:01,750
You... You see,
they have an aversion to... to water.

823
01:18:02,718 --> 01:18:04,721
One could almost call it a phobia.

824
01:18:05,221 --> 01:18:08,458
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

825
01:18:08,558 --> 01:18:09,843
Right.

826
01:18:10,143 --> 01:18:12,128
Well, for now, let's just say...

827
01:18:12,228 --> 01:18:14,881
that you were the subject of their experiment.

828
01:18:14,981 --> 01:18:16,356
W... We all are.

829
01:18:18,551 --> 01:18:20,569
You're not crazy, John.

830
01:18:21,362 --> 01:18:23,071
And you are not a murderer.

831
01:18:25,032 --> 01:18:26,726
I'm sorry about this. I truly am.

832
01:18:26,826 --> 01:18:28,311
But we do not have much time...

833
01:18:28,411 --> 01:18:30,980
and I cannot afford the luxury
of doing this the right way.

834
01:18:31,080 --> 01:18:32,523
Everything you need to know...

835
01:18:32,623 --> 01:18:34,901
all the answers are in this syringe.

836
01:18:35,001 --> 01:18:36,252
I need you to inject yourself.

837
01:18:36,352 --> 01:18:38,571
It's the only way to make you understand.

838
01:18:38,671 --> 01:18:39,906
You're kidding me, right?

839
01:18:40,006 --> 01:18:42,966
We're running out of time, John.
You have to do this now.

840
01:18:43,593 --> 01:18:44,994
Give me the gun, Doctor.

841
01:18:45,094 --> 01:18:47,455
Inspector, he is more disturbed
than we thought.

842
01:18:47,555 --> 01:18:50,208
I may not be the judge of personality
that you are, Doctor...

843
01:18:50,308 --> 01:18:53,268
but you're the one
who looks disturbed to me.

844
01:18:54,187 --> 01:18:55,979
You do not know what you are doing.

845
01:18:57,190 --> 01:19:00,775
What, exactly is in this... Doctor?

846
01:19:02,528 --> 01:19:04,680
All the answers
you've been looking for, John.

847
01:19:04,780 --> 01:19:05,807
I swear to you.

848
01:19:07,708 --> 01:19:10,600
Guess I'll just have to hold on to it for...

849
01:19:10,801 --> 01:19:12,297
safekeeping.

850
01:19:12,497 --> 01:19:13,648
If you don't mind.

851
01:19:13,748 --> 01:19:15,123
Let's go, Doctor.

852
01:19:16,459 --> 01:19:17,511
Go?

853
01:19:18,212 --> 01:19:19,666
Where are we going?

854
01:19:19,866 --> 01:19:22,096
Shell Beach.

855
01:19:22,882 --> 01:19:25,159
That's where you want to go, isn't it?

856
01:19:25,259 --> 01:19:26,843
The ocean.

857
01:19:35,895 --> 01:19:37,395
Why are you doing this?

858
01:19:39,106 --> 01:19:40,675
What do you hope to gain by helping me?

859
01:19:40,775 --> 01:19:42,317
The truth.

860
01:19:43,110 --> 01:19:46,013
None of these maps extend far enough
to show the ocean.

861
01:19:46,113 --> 01:19:47,432
You won't find anything there...

862
01:19:47,532 --> 01:19:49,392
I promise you!
I've been there, and...

863
01:19:49,492 --> 01:19:52,035
If you've been there,
you can show us the way, then, can't you?

864
01:19:53,162 --> 01:19:54,746
We'll see for ourselves.

865
01:19:55,831 --> 01:19:56,831
I won't.

866
01:19:58,000 --> 01:20:00,752
I refuse.
You... You can't make me go there!

867
01:20:12,974 --> 01:20:15,183
You were saying, doctor?

868
01:20:26,904 --> 01:20:30,448
I don't understand.
Used to be a bridge here.

869
01:20:37,206 --> 01:20:38,806
Try that again,
your friends are gonna be...

870
01:20:38,906 --> 01:20:40,106
fishing you out of the canal.

871
01:20:40,209 --> 01:20:41,527
Just don't hurt me.
I'll tell you everything.

872
01:20:41,627 --> 01:20:43,670
It doesn't matter anymore anyway.

873
01:20:50,636 --> 01:20:51,887
What?

874
01:20:54,773 --> 01:20:56,808
Who are you people?

875
01:21:00,938 --> 01:21:03,813
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...

876
01:21:04,714 --> 01:21:05,838
Anna.

877
01:21:05,943 --> 01:21:07,352
I'm not Anna.

878
01:21:08,988 --> 01:21:10,905
You will be soon, yes.

879
01:21:14,994 --> 01:21:17,871
I have another use for her first.

880
01:21:24,587 --> 01:21:29,799
First there was darkness.
Then came the strangers.

881
01:21:31,969 --> 01:21:34,262
They abducted us and brought us here.

882
01:21:35,556 --> 01:21:38,251
This city, everyone in it...

883
01:21:38,351 --> 01:21:39,669
is their experiment.

884
01:21:39,769 --> 01:21:42,588
They mix and match our memories
as they see fit...

885
01:21:42,688 --> 01:21:45,740
trying to divine what makes us unique.

886
01:21:46,150 --> 01:21:48,844
One day, a man might be an inspector.

887
01:21:48,944 --> 01:21:51,847
The next, someone entirely different.

888
01:21:51,947 --> 01:21:55,184
When they want to study
a murderer for instance...

889
01:21:55,284 --> 01:21:59,079
they simply imprint one of their citizens
with a new personality...

890
01:22:00,206 --> 01:22:04,209
arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

891
01:22:05,002 --> 01:22:06,044
even a lost wallet.

892
01:22:06,629 --> 01:22:08,296
Then they observe the results.

893
01:22:09,757 --> 01:22:13,786
Will a man, given the history
of a killer, continue in that vein?

894
01:22:13,886 --> 01:22:17,832
Or are we, in fact, more
than the mere sum of our memories?

895
01:22:17,932 --> 01:22:22,878
This business of you being a killer
was an unhappy coincidence.

896
01:22:22,978 --> 01:22:25,756
You have had dozens of lives
before now.

897
01:22:25,856 --> 01:22:29,192
You just happened to wake up
while I was imprinting you with this one.

898
01:22:29,985 --> 01:22:32,054
Why are they doing all of this?

899
01:22:32,154 --> 01:22:35,474
It is our capacity for individuality...

900
01:22:35,574 --> 01:22:38,060
our souls that makes
us different from them.

901
01:22:38,160 --> 01:22:40,479
They think they
can find the human soul...

902
01:22:40,579 --> 01:22:43,649
if they understand
how our memories work.

903
01:22:43,749 --> 01:22:45,042
All they have are collective memories.

904
01:22:45,142 --> 01:22:47,820
They share one group mind.

905
01:22:47,920 --> 01:22:49,322
They're dying, you see?

906
01:22:49,422 --> 01:22:52,783
Their entire race
is on the brink of extinction.

907
01:22:52,883 --> 01:22:54,702
They think we can save them.

908
01:22:54,802 --> 01:22:57,220
- Where do I fit in?
- You are different, John.

909
01:22:57,847 --> 01:23:00,682
You resisted my attempt
to imprint you.

910
01:23:05,354 --> 01:23:08,674
Somehow you have developed
their ability to tune.

911
01:23:08,774 --> 01:23:10,267
That is how they change things.

912
01:23:10,367 --> 01:23:11,952
That is how they built this city.

913
01:23:12,052 --> 01:23:14,613
They have machines buried deep
beneath the surface...

914
01:23:14,713 --> 01:23:18,533
that allow them
to focus their telepathic energies.

915
01:23:19,410 --> 01:23:21,812
They control everything here,
even the sun.

916
01:23:21,912 --> 01:23:25,232
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

917
01:23:25,332 --> 01:23:26,525
So why do they need you?

918
01:23:26,625 --> 01:23:30,946
When they first brought us here,
they extracted what was in us.

919
01:23:31,046 --> 01:23:34,825
So they could store the information,
remix it like so much paint...

920
01:23:34,925 --> 01:23:37,411
and give us back new memories
of their choosing.

921
01:23:37,511 --> 01:23:41,139
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

922
01:23:42,975 --> 01:23:46,087
I understood the intricacies
of the human mind...

923
01:23:46,187 --> 01:23:48,631
better than they ever could...

924
01:23:48,731 --> 01:23:51,425
so they allowed me
to keep my skills as a scientist...

925
01:23:51,525 --> 01:23:52,885
because they needed them.

926
01:23:52,985 --> 01:23:55,445
But they made me
delete everything else.

927
01:24:03,829 --> 01:24:06,607
Can you imagine
what it is like being forced...

928
01:24:06,707 --> 01:24:08,359
to erase your own past?

929
01:24:08,459 --> 01:24:11,795
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

930
01:24:12,713 --> 01:24:15,423
Shell Beach, Uncle Karl.

931
01:24:16,175 --> 01:24:17,467
What about this?

932
01:24:18,385 --> 01:24:20,204
This was blank when I found it!

933
01:24:20,304 --> 01:24:22,289
You still don't understand, John.

934
01:24:22,389 --> 01:24:25,501
You were never a boy...
not in this place.

935
01:24:25,601 --> 01:24:28,337
Your entire history is an illusion,
a fabrication...

936
01:24:28,437 --> 01:24:30,256
as it is with all of us.

937
01:24:30,356 --> 01:24:32,800
You made those drawings
happen with your gift.

938
01:24:32,900 --> 01:24:34,776
You say they brought us here.

939
01:24:36,570 --> 01:24:37,737
From where?

940
01:24:41,534 --> 01:24:42,575
I'm sorry.

941
01:24:43,702 --> 01:24:45,396
I don't remember.

942
01:24:45,496 --> 01:24:47,247
None of us remember that...

943
01:24:47,957 --> 01:24:49,483
what we once were...

944
01:24:49,583 --> 01:24:51,944
what we might have been...

945
01:24:52,044 --> 01:24:53,419
somewhere else.

946
01:25:10,896 --> 01:25:12,798
I've taken you this far.

947
01:25:12,898 --> 01:25:14,967
You don't need me anymore.

948
01:25:15,067 --> 01:25:16,860
Let's go.

949
01:25:35,087 --> 01:25:36,880
John.

950
01:26:00,988 --> 01:26:03,724
There is no ocean, John.

951
01:26:03,824 --> 01:26:07,895
There is nothing beyond the city.

952
01:26:07,995 --> 01:26:11,331
The only place home exists...

953
01:26:13,167 --> 01:26:15,168
is in your head.

954
01:26:23,510 --> 01:26:25,204
No! No!

955
01:26:25,304 --> 01:26:27,096
John, stop!

956
01:26:29,683 --> 01:26:30,808
No!

957
01:26:33,520 --> 01:26:34,812
Stop!

958
01:26:40,486 --> 01:26:41,694
Please!

959
01:26:42,529 --> 01:26:43,738
No!

960
01:27:02,216 --> 01:27:04,384
And now you know the truth.

961
01:27:23,737 --> 01:27:24,930
No!

962
01:28:12,995 --> 01:28:15,856
You'll allow yourself
to surrender, Mr. Murdoch...

963
01:28:15,956 --> 01:28:18,108
or it will result in
this one's death, yes?

964
01:28:18,208 --> 01:28:20,694
What do I care?
She's not my real wife!

965
01:28:20,794 --> 01:28:21,862
She's nothing to me!

966
01:28:21,962 --> 01:28:26,116
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

967
01:28:26,216 --> 01:28:28,827
You see, I have become the monster...

968
01:28:28,927 --> 01:28:30,871
you were intended to be.

969
01:28:32,723 --> 01:28:36,642
Shall I end her life now
as you would have?

970
01:28:39,688 --> 01:28:41,840
Don't hurt her, please!

971
01:28:41,940 --> 01:28:46,512
Then surrender, Mr. Murdoch.

972
01:28:46,612 --> 01:28:48,237
Sleep.

973
01:28:50,074 --> 01:28:52,283
Now.

974
01:28:54,078 --> 01:28:55,787
John?

975
01:29:10,803 --> 01:29:11,969
Sleep.

976
01:29:33,826 --> 01:29:36,702
The doctor was right.
He has evolved.

977
01:29:37,079 --> 01:29:38,522
Kill him.

978
01:29:38,622 --> 01:29:40,689
Kill him! Kill him!

979
01:29:44,419 --> 01:29:47,130
Kill him! Kill him!

980
01:29:49,800 --> 01:29:52,286
He is powerful, yes.

981
01:29:52,386 --> 01:29:53,687
Dangerous.

982
01:29:53,788 --> 01:29:56,790
But he can also lead us
to what we seek.

983
01:29:56,890 --> 01:30:00,210
What the doctor calls the soul.

984
01:30:00,310 --> 01:30:03,964
It is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

985
01:30:04,064 --> 01:30:06,717
We no longer need the other subjects.

986
01:30:06,817 --> 01:30:10,387
The time for study is over.

987
01:30:10,487 --> 01:30:12,547
It is time to be one...

988
01:30:12,948 --> 01:30:14,999
with John Murdoch.

989
01:30:21,373 --> 01:30:23,150
It is time, Doctor.

990
01:30:23,250 --> 01:30:24,792
Imprint.

991
01:30:27,588 --> 01:30:30,282
Shut it down!

992
01:30:30,382 --> 01:30:33,551
Shut it down forever!

993
01:30:47,441 --> 01:30:49,635
What are you doing?

994
01:30:49,735 --> 01:30:54,280
They want to imprint you
with their own collective memories.

995
01:30:55,616 --> 01:30:59,744
They want to make you one of them,
so they can share your soul.

996
01:31:05,918 --> 01:31:08,153
Imprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

997
01:31:08,253 --> 01:31:10,030
I'm sorry, John.

998
01:31:10,130 --> 01:31:13,132
The pain will only last a moment.

999
01:31:15,260 --> 01:31:16,260
No!

1000
01:31:24,645 --> 01:31:25,937
Remember, John.

1001
01:31:27,189 --> 01:31:29,091
You'll rise to greater heights
than that, my boy.

1002
01:31:29,191 --> 01:31:30,983
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

1003
01:31:32,736 --> 01:31:34,070
Remember.

1004
01:31:35,197 --> 01:31:37,975
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

1005
01:31:38,075 --> 01:31:41,228
Now remember what I told you.
Never talk to strangers.

1006
01:31:41,328 --> 01:31:43,063
John, remember.

1007
01:31:43,163 --> 01:31:45,941
You're probably wondering
why I keep appearing in your memories.

1008
01:31:46,041 --> 01:31:48,527
It is because I have
inserted myself in them.

1009
01:31:48,627 --> 01:31:50,654
All of these memories
have been fabricated...

1010
01:31:50,754 --> 01:31:52,406
to teach you about the strangers.

1011
01:31:52,506 --> 01:31:55,633
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

1012
01:31:58,470 --> 01:32:00,789
You will survive, John.

1013
01:32:00,889 --> 01:32:03,125
You will find strength within yourself...

1014
01:32:03,225 --> 01:32:05,127
and you will prevail.

1015
01:32:05,327 --> 01:32:06,660
Remember.

1016
01:32:07,354 --> 01:32:08,497
Hi, Uncle Karl.

1017
01:32:08,597 --> 01:32:09,797
Johnny!

1018
01:32:12,401 --> 01:32:14,428
You're getting the hang of it, John.

1019
01:32:14,528 --> 01:32:16,570
Maybe one day I'll be working for you.

1020
01:32:17,406 --> 01:32:20,559
This is the machine the strangers use
to amplify their thoughts.

1021
01:32:20,659 --> 01:32:22,477
The machine that changes their world.

1022
01:32:22,577 --> 01:32:24,062
You must take control of it.

1023
01:32:24,162 --> 01:32:25,731
You must make the machine yours.

1024
01:32:25,831 --> 01:32:27,900
I know you can beat them, John.

1025
01:32:28,000 --> 01:32:30,501
But you must concentrate.

1026
01:32:32,713 --> 01:32:33,796
Something's wrong.

1027
01:32:42,431 --> 01:32:45,125
There is no time for romance, John.

1028
01:32:45,225 --> 01:32:47,502
The world can be what you make it.

1029
01:32:47,602 --> 01:32:49,546
What have you done?

1030
01:32:49,646 --> 01:32:52,132
You have the power
to make anything happen...

1031
01:32:52,232 --> 01:32:53,733
but you must act now!

1032
01:37:38,602 --> 01:37:40,003
I knew you could do it, John.

1033
01:37:40,103 --> 01:37:42,088
You have their power now.

1034
01:37:42,188 --> 01:37:43,965
You control their machines.

1035
01:37:44,065 --> 01:37:45,382
Where's Emma?

1036
01:37:46,234 --> 01:37:48,970
She is not Emma anymore, John.

1037
01:37:49,070 --> 01:37:50,430
She has been reimprinted.

1038
01:37:50,530 --> 01:37:52,140
So give her back her memories.

1039
01:37:52,240 --> 01:37:53,240
I can't.

1040
01:37:53,340 --> 01:37:55,940
The facility where the strangers
stored the memories...

1041
01:37:56,040 --> 01:37:57,549
has been destroyed.

1042
01:37:57,746 --> 01:37:59,256
I'm sorry.

1043
01:37:59,956 --> 01:38:02,466
What are you going to do now, John?

1044
01:38:04,419 --> 01:38:06,239
You told me I had the power,

1045
01:38:07,040 --> 01:38:08,313
didn't you?

1046
01:38:08,590 --> 01:38:11,591
I can make these machines
do anything I want.

1047
01:38:12,761 --> 01:38:15,095
Make this world anything
I want it to be.

1048
01:38:16,097 --> 01:38:17,755
Just so long as I...

1049
01:38:18,356 --> 01:38:20,241
concentrate hard enough.

1050
01:39:44,018 --> 01:39:45,394
Where are you going?

1051
01:39:48,356 --> 01:39:49,815
Shell Beach.

1052
01:40:30,690 --> 01:40:32,065
- What's the fare?
- Quarter.

1053
01:40:38,323 --> 01:40:39,465
Oh, please.

1054
01:40:39,565 --> 01:40:41,810
- Oh, no...
- It's fine.

1055
01:40:41,910 --> 01:40:43,327
- Thank you.
- OK.

1056
01:41:23,535 --> 01:41:25,410
John...

1057
01:41:28,957 --> 01:41:31,124
Been waiting for you, yes?

1058
01:41:31,835 --> 01:41:32,902
What are you doing?

1059
01:41:33,002 --> 01:41:36,322
I'm just making a few little changes
around here, is all.

1060
01:41:36,422 --> 01:41:38,131
Are we sure that's what we want?

1061
01:41:38,633 --> 01:41:41,035
I'm prepared to take my chances.

1062
01:41:41,135 --> 01:41:42,537
I'm dying, John.

1063
01:41:42,637 --> 01:41:45,639
Your imprint is not
agreeable with my kind.

1064
01:41:47,100 --> 01:41:49,351
But I wanted to know
what it was like...

1065
01:41:50,728 --> 01:41:52,172
how you feel.

1066
01:41:52,272 --> 01:41:54,883
You know how I was supposed to feel.

1067
01:41:54,983 --> 01:41:58,720
That person isn't me.
Never was.

1068
01:41:58,820 --> 01:42:02,531
You wanted to know what it was
about us that made us human.

1069
01:42:03,908 --> 01:42:07,244
Well, you're not going to find it...
in here.

1070
01:42:08,997 --> 01:42:11,623
You went looking in the wrong place.

1071
01:43:50,014 --> 01:43:51,932
It's so beautiful here.

1072
01:43:57,271 --> 01:43:58,730
So bright.

1073
01:44:04,612 --> 01:44:07,390
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

1074
01:44:07,490 --> 01:44:10,117
I think that's it just over there.

1075
01:44:28,302 --> 01:44:30,345
I'm headed that way myself.

1076
01:44:32,306 --> 01:44:34,307
Would you like to join me?

1077
01:44:36,477 --> 01:44:37,477
Sure.

1078
01:44:43,192 --> 01:44:45,470
I'm Anna, by the way.

1079
01:44:45,570 --> 01:44:47,821
- What's your name?
- John.

1080
01:44:50,241 --> 01:44:51,700
John Murdoch.

1081
01:51:41,000 --> 01:51:42,500
-- English --
